channel.title: How Are NPCs Processed?
channel.description:
I remember a while ago, Silabsoft did something on the subject I believe, but I don't know where to find it so I figured I'd ask. Right now for Rarity, only NPCs that were seen by a player the last update cycle or ones that currently have steps in their walking queue are processed. All others outside of the view region aren't. Is this right? I feel like it's not right since it's there's no chance any others will be processed (except dead ones but that's a different subject).
What is the view region for NPCs to be processed?
~Lin

item.title: How Are NPCs Processed?
item.dc:creator: @silabsoft RuneAgent
item.description:
@silabsoft wrote:

Some NPC’s simply do not need to be in the “process queue” at all times, For example certain quest npc only get accessed once in a blue moon, it makes more sense to house two lists of NPC’s ones that are active (in view, damaged, fighting) and those that are “sleeping” sleeping npcs just hold the definitions to be activated when something triggers them for example a player walks into the same region. When a NPC is not active (fighting,regenerating,respawning or in view) they should be put to sleep you are wasting processing time on them.

item.title: How Are NPCs Processed?
item.dc:creator: @RandQm RandQm
item.description:
@RandQm wrote:

The player itself requests updates, checks if he’s in the region (15 tiles) of an npc and will request visual updates for it if this is the case. Else they are just “existing” in the index.

item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

I’d say that if a player isn’t in a certain region, there’s no reason to have it loaded in memory.

The way I’m approaching it is that there are Regions in which players, npcs, objects, items, etc reside, that is (I believe) 64x64 tiles large. All of the entities would exist in that region, but perhaps not yet exist to the player (ie. they’re not withing visible distance).

Like healing health etc (Not sure if this counts as an update though)[/quote]Well yeah, but I need to know the radius for what counts as in the area. Right now it’s the update view area, but it feels weird having the power to make an NPC stationary until you walk one tile.

[quote=“Tmesis, post:3, topic:470097”]Surely the server has to check every NPC anyway to check if it needs processing or not (doesn’t really make sense I know).[/quote]Not true. If you keep a list of all the NPCs that need to be updated - ones in the viewing area of another player, that have been hurt, that were dead, etc… you won’t have to cycle through every NPC ever - if you have a good world system that is.
